originalText.text: I'm surprised by some of these other reviews, but everyone has different experiences with renting.  I'm a tenant in a building in Brooklyn managed by Icon, with Anastasia Duran as our contact and Cecilio Paquay as our super, and I came on to say that it's been the best management experience I've ever had as a renter.  Every problem we've had, from a roof leaking to drains clogged, has been fixed almost immediately, and our communication with management has always gotten prompt responses.  It seems a lot of reviews are upset about rent increases, but I figure that has more to do with the landlord's whims.  In my building, no one has had a rent increase of more than 4% with some units rent controlled, so I imagine it varies by the building's landlords rather than Icon itself, given other reviews report much different increases.  I had a really great interaction with management today where they reached out proactively to check on our water, and that made me reflect on how much better treatment we're getting compared to so many other New Yorkers.  If you are renting in a place without a greedy landlord, or own the property yourself, then I'd say you would really enjoy being managed under Icon!  Thank you Anastasia :)

originalText.text: Leasing Director Zach is like Tina Turner sang, "Simply the Best." Applied for a LES Barbie studio. Who could be better than these guys? Love everything about it.

text.text: Leasing Director Zach is like Tina Turner sang, "Simply the Best." Applied for a LES Barbie studio. Who could be better than these guys? Love everything about it.

originalText.text: Avoid this company. A plumber let himself in and removed our dishwasher, while my pregnant wife was sleeping "oops wrong apartment" they said. They're jacking up our rent almost 60% after a one year lease. Poor communication from the office, you have play phone tag with a handful of people to get anything done. They are the epitome of the worst you would expect from a corporate management company. We will never rent from them again. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

text.text: Avoid this company. A plumber let himself in and removed our dishwasher, while my pregnant wife was sleeping "oops wrong apartment" they said. They're jacking up our rent almost 60% after a one year lease. Poor communication from the office, you have play phone tag with a handful of people to get anything done. They are the epitome of the worst you would expect from a corporate management company. We will never rent from them again. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

originalText.text: An ICON of sleezy business practices. These stereotypes of sleezy, lying, bloodsucking NYC landlords violate the spirit, if not the letter of the law, as well as human decency. First, the building was infested with water bugs and rats, I got to hear the literal rat race every night in my ceiling! But even worse than the rats is the   lazy, do-nothing building "Super" who  always plays dumb and refuses to do anything, and just blames everything on the cheap landlords. I was a great tenant when they purchased my building. I had paid my rent on-time Every Month for 7 years to the previous owner, and then to Icon. They lied to me and everyone else in the building, claiming they wanted to keep everybody and would increase the rent no more than a normal amount... 3 to 5% maximum. They did this so we would put up with construction sledgehammers and jackhammers, and pay full rent. Well, I put up with at least four different jackhammers going off in four different directions at the same time around my apartment for about 10 months. I spoke to them and told them I was going out of town because my dad was very sick. They had my phone number and decided they would just collect my rent as long as possible since it was going to be difficult to rent to someone else with jackhammers going off. The MOMENT, and I mean the MOMENT I came back, their lazy, sleazy, do-nothing superintendent looked like he saw a ghost, ignored me, and ran to his apartment, then came back banging on my door like a lunatic telling me I have to talk to the management company right now on his phone!!  Of course, they had my phone number, my phone worked just fine... they were just playing games. They wanted to wait until the second I got back to tell me "You have to get out, get out, get out!!",  they said they  were going to TRIPLE my rent if I didn't get out immediately! They didn't have the balls to do it when I was at my family's house dealing with my sick father, so they decided to act like disrespectful creeps the very second I came back. They lied and  pretended they tried to call me (I had actually sent them a letter before I left- giving them my parents house phone and reminding them of my cell phone number, which they already had on file. Later on,  one of the women who runs their office, Maria, admitted it was a lie and they were just playing games. Three of their handyman also broke into my apartment, they had been peeping in my window and thought I was out. I left my door unlocked for a few minutes and I heard all three of them come in sneaking around and saying : "let's see if this Bleep-Hole has anything good". I called the police, I pressed charges against all three of them, but ICON tried to pretend it was just a misunderstanding, and then blamed the agency they used which hires criminals.  You've been warned! ðŸ’©ðŸ‘¹
